pros: If you want to align yourself with back-stabbing thieves who engage in illegal, mismanagement of money and lie to students in order to soak even more money from poor, naive community members, enroll today! Enrollment has steadily declined over the years while administrators steal from Paul to pay Peter (and themselves). Daily they break the law and Middle States Accreditation by having unqualified professors teach, not paying faculty for overloads, and violating their contracts.
cons: If you can read and have a brain, the above is rife with sarcasm and you can tell there really are no positives.

job_title: Bccc Adjunct Professor in Baltimore, MD
pros: Most of the students were interested in learning, many of my colleagues were great.
cons: The administration was extremely disorganized, requiring their employees to submit the same paperwork over and over, giving almost no advanced warning for mandatory meetings and lining up teachers just days before the semester began. Pay is among the lowest of all the city schools for adjunct professors. During my time there, the heads of the departments and schools switched every semester, leaving us pretty devoid of continuity, reliable leaders and consistent protocol.

review_title: Too Many Changes To The Recipe
job_title: PC Support Technician in Baltimore, MD
pros: It WAS a relaxed and easy atmosphere to learn, refine and execute your skills. Health insurance was the biggest attraction.
cons: Advancement is limited to not what you know but who you know. You will be used as a Kleenex. The college has lacked direction for years and it is exemplified by its management choices. Double standards,  lack of empathy and self-serving directives permeated throughout the workplace. Don't work here unless you enjoy stress.
